qas.question: When do long distance migrants disperse?
What do young birds form attachments to?
What else do young birds form attachments to?
What happens when the site attachment is made?

answers.text: the same wintering sites year after year

context: Long distance migrants are believed to disperse <a0_0>as young birds<a0_0/> and form attachments to <a1_0>potential breeding sites<a1_0/> and to favourite <a2_0>wintering sites<a2_0/>. Once the site attachment is made <a3_0>they show high site-fidelity<a3_0/>, visiting <a4_0>the same wintering sites year after year<a4_0/>.
